paper_abstract: Electronic properties of ABC-stacked graphite are studied by the first-principles method There are linear and parabolic bands with strong anisotropic dispersions both non-degenerate and degenerate bands are observed The bandwidths of occupied pi and sigma bands are 841 eV and 16 65 eV respectively The low valence and conduction bands only have slight overlapping near the Fermi level mainly owing to the interlayer atomic interactions State degeneracy and energy dispersions are strongly affected by such interactions The band-edge states with the high density of states are located near or at the high symmetry points Some significant differences exist among ABC- AB- and AA-stacked graphites in electronic properties (C) 2010 Elsevier BV All rights reserved
